msbt.message: You know what? TV has changed, kiddo. I don't even watch the news anymore. How about you? You fire up the ol' big screen much these days?
Yeah, an hour a day.
Almost never.
All day, every day.

Ahh, I like that. Sounds like you've got some real self-control.Every now and then I'll get sucked into one of those shows where they follow baby penguins around all day. Go on, ask me anything about baby penguins! Gahaha!
Is that right? Well, good for you, kiddo.There's so much to do when you're young and wild. Climbin' trees, climbin' rocks, climbin' mountains Alright, it's mostly just climbin'. Gahaha!

Ha! Bonus points for honesty, kiddo. Guess you're a true-blue child of the cable generation, huh? Just one thingâ€”where do you find the time for fishin' or bug catchin' if you're always on the tube? Lemme let you in on a little secret Everything in moderation! Gahaha!
Heya. I'm kinda in a bad mood, so I'm just gonna grumble at you for a moment. I don't like the hospital!

What's the first thing that comes to mind when you think of the hospital? Needles, right? Gah! They're always like, "Oh, this won't hurt a bit," and then it really stings! Ooh! They can't fool me anymore. Next time I need a shot, I'm gonna make 'em blend it into a smoothie or somethin'.
It's the smell! You get a whiff of that antiseptic or whatever and it's just likepee-yew! And don't get me started on the food. I'd rather eat stuffed with . Yep. I'm not a fan, kiddo.

When I was a kid, I was in the hospital all the time.<10_4 /> Nothin' serious, just normal kid stuff.Y'know, like horsin' around with my friends and jumpin' down wells and fightin' wolverines and such. I was always so covered in bandages that other kids started callin' me "the mummy." <10_4 />Best nickname ever!
I've gotten soft in my old age, but I'll have you know I was quite the hooligan when I was younger!
I had these shoes that were, like, real long shoesYou don't understand. All the tough guys were really into wearing long shoes back then. Hey, quit laughin'!
I used to wear these pants that were so big you could legally use 'em as a parachute. You couldn't run in 'em. You could barely even walk! But everyone knew you were super tough.

Y'see, I used to have this real sweet motorbikeI lowered the seat almost down to the street level, and I raised the handlebars way up above my head. I couldn't steer, see, or even hear anything, probably 'cause o' the super loud exhaust I had installed But boy howdy did I look tough! Gahaha!
Heh, hehOh, sorry, kiddo. I was just thinkin' about this weird thing I used to do when I was younger
We used to play this crazy game where someone was "it," and they had to run around and "tag" us. Can't for the life of me remember what it was called, though Wait, was it called "it"?
Me and my pals used to pretend we were old and grown-up with jobs and everything. I'd act like I just got home from work all tired and worn-out from the day Ugh. Little did we know

Me and my pals invented this game where you get a regular old piece of rope and take turns jumpin' over it. We called it Ropey Jumpey, and I'm pretty sure we were the first ones to ever think of it. Anyhow, one time Jimmy got all tangled up and he was stuck there until March! Can't remember what month we started playin'
I always end up lookin' goofy in pictures. How does everyone else manage to act natural on camera?

Anytime I know someone's pointin' a camera at me, I just tense up. I never know what I should do, . They always say, "Just act natural!" If I'm actin', by definition, there ain't nothin' natural about what I'm doin'.

Wait Maybe I should just make sure I'm talkin' to you whenever I think someone might be snappin' photos! No matter how wound up I am, talkin' to you puts me at ease. So that'd be the best time to take my picture!
There's nothin' like lookin' up at the night sky full of stars, kiddo. Really makes you think

Likehow can I see that star that's about a bazillion miles away, but I can't read my paper without glasses?What if the bottom of the oceans and the top of the mountains are kinda the samein a way?If falls off the shelf in my garage but I ain't there to hear it, does it make a sound?Bah! That's enough deep thinkin' for now. I'll just go back to gazin' at the stars

You know, they say everything's made outta stardust or somethin', right? But how can that be? You're tellin' me that my is made outta stardust? And my ?!And what about the I had for dinner last night? I was eatin' stars?! <10_4 />Well, it was spicy

Likedon't those stars kinda look like tiny grains of rice?And who figured out that we can eat rice, anyhow? Were folks just tastin' things and hopin' for the best?And how does taste work? How come is delicious, and fried mud is slightly less delicious?Don't ask any questions about the fried mud. It was a different time in my life, .
